title: Do What The Fuck You Want To But It's Not My Fault Public License v1 (WTFNMFPL-1.0)
description: Essentially very similar to Sam Hocevar's WTF Public License version 2.0, except with a CYA clause for the author(s), developer(s) and distributor(s).

cannot.title: Hold Liable
cannot.description: Describes the warranty and if the software/license owner can be charged for damages.

can.title: Commercial Use
can.description: Describes the ability to use the software for commercial purposes.

can.title: Modify
can.description: Describes the ability to modify the software and create derivatives.

can.title: Distribute
can.description: Describes the ability to distribute original or modified (derivative) works.

can.title: Sublicense
can.description: Describes the ability for you to grant/extend a license to the software.

can.title: Include Copyright
can.description: Describes whether the original copyright must be retained.

can.title: Include Original
can.description: Describes whether copies of the original software or instructions to obtain copies must be distributed with the software.

can.title: Include License
can.description: Including the full text of license in modified software.

can.title: Private Use
can.description: Describes the ability to use/modify software freely without distributing it.

can.title: Contact Author
can.description: Describes your ability to contact the author about the module you're using.

fulltext:
DO WHAT THE FUCK YOU WANT TO BUT IT'S NOT MY FAULT PUBLIC LICENSE
Version 1, October 2013

Copyright © 2013 Ben McGinnes <ben@adversary.org>

Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim or modified copies of this license document, and changing it is allowed as long as the name is changed.

DO WHAT THE FUCK YOU WANT TO BUT IT'S NOT MY FAULT PUBLIC LICENSE TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR COPYING, DISTRIBUTION AND MODIFICATION

0. You just DO WHAT THE FUCK YOU WANT TO.

1. Do not hold the author(s), creator(s), developer(s) or distributor(s) liable for anything that happens or goes wrong with your use of the work.
